articles.author: Orhan Qereman
articles.description: Kurdish-led authorities who run a sprawling camp for Islamic State-linked prisoners in northeast Syria are preparing the first-ever return of detainees to Syrian areas, the camp director said, a move enabled by the fall of the Assad regime.
articles.title: Syria's al-Hol camp readies first return of Syrian detainees, director says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli operations in the West Bank have killed at least 12 Palestinians since Tuesday and could threaten the newly agreed ceasefire in Gaza, United Nations Human Rights office spokesperson Thameen Al-Kheetan said on Friday.
articles.title: West Bank violence imperils Gaza ceasefire, UN rights office warns

articles.author: Tim Reid
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and his team have acted with stunning speed to begin removing or sidelining hundreds of government workers, while he has also sought to give himself the power to fire hundreds of thousands more.
articles.title: Trump's rapid changes in U.S. government stun federal workers

articles.author: Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Naser Zazai, 29, had planned to reunite with his mother and brother in the United States this week after fleeing Afghanistan, where he says he was threatened and attacked because his brother had once worked for the U.S. military.
articles.title: Afghans stranded in Mexico under Trump immigration crackdown face bleak choices

articles.author: Alexandra Ulmer, Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: After Honduran migrant Alex Diaz' U.S. asylum appointment was canceled following Donald Trump's immigration and border crackdown, the 23-year-old former bus driver began considering what he had been determined to avoid: entering the United States illegally.
articles.title: Some migrants turn to pricey smugglers or riskier routes after Trump clampdown

articles.author: Wa Lone, Kyawsoe Oo
articles.description: Donald Trump's verbal threats towards Canada are paying off for one entrepreneur, after the new U.S. president's belligerent approach gave him an idea.
articles.title: 'Canada is not for sale' hat goes viral after Trump threats

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg, Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: The International Criminal Court has taken measures to shield staff from possible U.S. sanctions, paying salaries three months in advance, as it braces for financial restrictions that could cripple the war crimes tribunal, two sources said on Friday.
articles.title: Exclusive: International Criminal Court prepares for possible US sanctions

articles.author: Andrew R.C. Marshall, Linda So
articles.description: The credit-card companies knew people were using their networks to pay for illegal content since at least 2021, the whistleblower said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Whistleblower says Mastercard, Visa failed to stop payments for child sex-abuse content on OnlyFans

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said on Friday that it remained deployed in southern Lebanon while maintaining the terms of the ceasefire deal.
articles.title: Israeli military says it remains deployed in southern Lebanon

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: A South Korean court on Friday rejected a request from the prosecutors' office to extend the detention of impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol over a criminal investigation into his short-lived martial law declaration on Dec. 3, Yonhap reported.
articles.title: South Korea court rejects request to extend Yoon's detention
